intro: Hedyotis articularis subsp. santapaui, commonly known as the Santa Paula germander, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
